AVSEC ORDER 03/2019

In exercise of powers conferred by Section SA of the Aircraft Act, 1934 (XXII of
1934), read with rule 3 (b) of the Aircraft (Security) Rules, 2011, Director General,
Bureau of Civil Aviation Security (DG, BCAS), for the purpose of the safety of
passengers, crew, ground personnel and the general public in all matters relating to
safeguarding against acts of unlawfal interference with civil aviation, directs that Security
Programme shall be implemented by Authorized Agent / Custom house Agent / Freight
Forwarders, General Sales Agent (GSA), General Sales and Services Agent (GSSA) and
all airline representational services providers in India, The model template is available
on the BCAS restricted site.

2. In terms of the said provisions, every Authorized Agent / Custom house Agent /
Freight Forwarders,-General Sales Agent (GSA), General Sales and Services Agent
(GSSA) and all airline representational services provider shall, with the approval of DG,
BCAS, make and comply with the Security Programme for such entities as per said
template and any amendment to such programme shall be made only after the approval
of DG, BCAS. No Authorized Agent } Custom house Agent / Freight Forwarders,
General Sales Agent (GSA), General Sales and Services Agent (GSSA) and all airline
representational services providers shall be allowed to commence its operations in India
unless its Security Programme has been approved by the DG, BCAS.”

3. The Security Programme for Authorized Agent / Custom house Agent / Freight
Forwarders, General Sales Agent (GSA), General Sales and Services Agent (GSSA) and
all airline representational services providers shall be valid for a period of five (05) years
and it shall be updated in accordance with the security directions issued by the DG, BCAS
